University of Leicester https://www2.le.ac.uk These are the search results for the query, showing results 1 to 15. Stuart Hill signs copies of his book 'I Was There...Richard III' https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/march/stuart-hill-signs-copies-of-his-book-i-was-there-richard-iii University of Leicester Bookshop - 21 Mar 2015, 02:30PM - 03:30PM We are delighted to welcome prize-winning author Stuart Hill here to sign copies of his book for younger readers, I Was There...Richard III as part of a free day of family-friendly activities celebrating the University of Leicester\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds research, discovery and identification of Richard III.

The Year is 1464 and a 12 year old Richard, Duke of Gloucester, is under the protection of the Earl of Warwick at Middleham Castle in Yorkshire. Here, he is immersed in knights' training, and along with his friend Francis Lovell, the boys yearn for their first experience of battle. Richard is thrilled to discover they are to ride with the Yorkist army, to Hexham, where they expect to meet Lancastrian opposition. How close can they get to their first blooding for the Yorkist cause, as the Wars of the Roses rages around them?

]]> No publisher pt91 Event:Arts College:Arts Magazine:Staff 2015-03-21T14:30:00Z UoL Event Launch of 'The Bones of A King: Richard III Rediscovered' https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/march/launch-of-the-bones-of-a-king-richard-iii-rediscovered University of Leicester Bookshop - 21 Mar 2015, 01:00PM - 02:00PM Written by The Grey Friars Research Team here at the University\ufffd\ufffdand Maev Kennedy\ufffd\ufffdfrom The Guardian. The book will be launched at an event at the University of Leicester at 1pm on Saturday 21st March in the University Bookshop with members of the team, as part of a free day of family-friendly activities celebrating the University of Leicester\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds research, discovery and identification of Richard III. Copies of the book will be available to purchase from the University Bookshop.

]]> No publisher pt91 College:SciEng College:MedBioPsych College:Arts Magazine:Staff Event:Lecture College:SocSci Magazine:Research 2015-03-21T13:00:00Z UoL Event 'For the Benefit of the Nation - The National Trust in the Twenty-first Century' https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/march/for-the-benefit-of-the-nation-the-national-trust-in-the-twenty-first-century Ken Edwards Lecture Theatre 1 - 16 Mar 2015, 05:30PM - 06:30PM No publisher User Submitted College:Arts Magazine:Staff Event:Lecture 2015-03-16T17:30:00Z UoL Event 'Seeing a natural history museum through young children\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds photographs' https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/march/seeing-a-natural-history-museum-through-young-children2019s-photographs Leicester Adult Education College, 2 Wellington St, Leicester City Centre - 20 Mar 2015, 12:00PM - 01:00PM Most of us have visited museums with children, or as children, but few of us ask what the museum visit is actually like for a child. This talk describes research in which children aged four and five years were given a digital camera to photograph their visit around a natural history museum. The photographs and discussions with the children revealed aspects of their visit that were unknown to their parents, and gave insights into the ways in which the children made sense of the museum objects, from eggs to dinosaurs.

The lecture will be illustrated by the children\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds photographs. The Lunchtime Lecture series takes place Fridays, 12-1pm at the Leicester Adult Education College, located at 2 Wellington St, near the city end of New Walk. The lectures are delivered by current University of Leicester postgraduates and are open to the public, so there is no need to book, just come along on the day.

]]> No publisher User Submitted Magazine:Staff College:Arts Event:Lecture Magazine:Research 2015-03-20T12:00:00Z UoL Event 'The \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdimagined visitor\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdother\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd: How social exclusion is embedded in science museum practice' https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/may/museum-studies-research-seminar-series Collections Room, School of Museum Studies - 06 May 2015, 01:00PM - 02:00PM Summarising her talk, Dr Emily Dawson said: "This paper explores social exclusion in museum practice by examining how people engage with science museums. Drawing on a study with socio-economically disadvantaged, minority-ethnic community groups and families and another study with students from inner-London schools, I will discuss how their museum visit experiences were disadvantageous in ways that were particularly marked by ethnicity, class and gender. In other words, getting people \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdthrough the door\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd did not necessarily mean they were included. Instead the visits raised significant issues about how resources such as museums play a part in the reproduction of social advantage & disadvantage. Finally, in an attempt to finish without totally depressing everyone, I will discuss what a framework for \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdinclusive\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd practice might look like and am really interested to hear what other people think about it."

]]> No publisher User Submitted College:Arts Magazine:Research Event:Lecture Magazine:Staff 2015-05-06T12:00:00Z UoL Event 'Belsen, 1945' https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/may/belsen-1945 Main Hall, Fraser Noble Building. - 13 May 2015, 07:00PM - 09:00PM Belsen, 1945 13th May, 2015, 7pm Main Hall, Fraser Noble Building.

Dr. Paul Moore (Stanley Burton Centre): Belsen as part of the Nazi camp system Prof. Aubrey Newman (Founder of the Stanley Burton Centre for Holocaust and Genocide Studies, University of Leicester): Belsen, 1945

An event to mark the 70th Anniversary of the end of the Second World War

]]> No publisher User Submitted Magazine:Research Magazine:Staff College:Arts Event:Lecture 2015-05-13T18:00:00Z UoL Event ''Slaves of the Caliphate' and 'Policeman of Kirkuk', BBC documentaries on the ISIS-state and the resistance against it' https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/march/slaves-of-the-caliphate-and-policeman-of-kirkuk-bbc-documentaries-on-the-isis-state-and-the-resistance-against-it Lecture Theatre 1, Basement, Attenborough Building - 18 Mar 2015, 06:00PM - 08:30PM 'Slaves of the Caliphate' and 'Policeman of Kirkuk', BBC documentaries on the ISIS-state and the resistance against it. 18 March, 2015, 6pm Lecture Theatre 1, Basement, Attenborough Building

Dr Alexander Korb (Stanley Burton Centre), Introduction

Namakh Koshnaw (Film Director, PhD-candidate in history, University of Leicester)

Screening of two BBC documentaries 'Slaves of the Caliphate' and 'Policeman of Kirkuk\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd directed by a Leicester PhD-candidate.

]]> No publisher User Submitted College:Arts Event:Lecture Magazine:Research Magazine:Staff 2015-03-18T18:00:00Z UoL Event The Armenian Genocide: the Local, the National and the Global. https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/march/the-armenian-genocide-the-local-the-national-and-the-global Lecture Theatre 8, Bennett Building - 10 March 2015, 06:00PM - 07:30PM The Armenian Genocide: the Local, the National and the Global. 10th March, 2015, 6pm Lecture Theatre 8, Bennett Building.

Dr. Ugur \ufffd\ufffdmit \ufffd\ufffdng\ufffd\ufffdr (Department of History at Utrecht University and Research Fellow at the Institute for War, Holocaust, and Genocide Studies in Amsterdam).

An Event to mark the 100th Anniversary of the Armenian Genocide.

]]> No publisher User Submitted Event:Lecture Magazine:Staff College:Arts Magazine:Student 2015-03-10T18:00:00Z UoL Event 'Authoring a Coup: the 1953 CIA Intervention in Iran' https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/march/authoring-a-coup-the-1953-cia-intervention-in-iran Astley Clarke Lecture Theatre - 12 Mar 2015, 05:30PM - 06:30PM This year\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds American Studies Annual Lecture will be given by Professor Hugh Wilford (California State University, Long Beach). Hugh is an internationally renowned scholar of the CIA, having published such books as America\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Great Game: The CIA\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Secret Arabists and the Shaping of the Modern Middle East and The Mighty Wurlitzer: How the CIA Played America, although he was initially trained as a U.S. intellectual historian, concentrating on the New York Intellectuals and the culture of the Cold War. He has taught in the United Kingdom, primarily at the University of Sheffield, before taking up a Chair in the History Department of California State University in 2006. His lecture focuses on the CIA\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds involvement in the 1953 coup in Iran, and is entitled, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdAuthoring a Coup: Kermit \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdKim\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Roosevelt, Imperial Romance, and the 1953 CIA Intervention in Iran.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd

The lecture will be in the Astley Clarke Lecture Theatre at 5:30pm on Thursday 12 March. All welcome.

]]> No publisher User Submitted Magazine:Research Magazine:Staff College:Arts Event:Lecture 2015-03-12T17:30:00Z UoL Event 'Le Scaphandre et le papillon: A Voice Beyond the Body' https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/march/le-scaphandre-et-le-papillon-a-voice-beyond-the-body ATT210 - 18 Mar 2015, 04:00PM - 05:00PM No publisher User Submitted Magazine:Staff Event:Lecture College:Arts Magazine:Research 2015-03-18T16:00:00Z UoL Event Midlands Viking Symposium 2015 https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/april/midlands-viking-symposium-2015 University of Leicester - 25 Apr 2015 The Midlands Viking Symposium 2015 will take place on 25 April 2015 at the University of Leicester. This year's speakers will include Mark Jobling, Pragya Vohra, Oliver Harris, Martin Findell, Aya Van Renterghem and Katherine Whitehouse.

This year's symposium will cover a range of exciting new research on topics ranging from the uses of genetic evidence for Viking migrations to Cnut the Great, from Northumbria in the Viking Age to runes and their uses.

A draft programme and booking form will be available shortly.

If you have any queries about this year's symposium, please contact Dr Philip A. Shaw.

]]> No publisher pt91 Magazine:Staff College:Arts Event:Conference Magazine:Research 2015-04-24T23:00:00Z UoL Event 'Flying in the Face of Adversity' https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/march/flying-in-the-face-of-adversity New Walk Museum, New Walk - 09 Mar 2015, 07:30PM - 08:30PM No publisher User Submitted Event:Lecture Magazine:Staff College:Arts 2015-03-09T19:30:00Z UoL Event 'Migration Stories: South Asian Histories and Cultures in Leicester' https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/march/migration-stories-south-asian-histories-and-cultures-in-leicester University of Leicester - 04 Mar 2015 - 05 Mar 2015 Join us for a special event as part of a collaborative project between the University of Leicester and Maharaja Sayajirao University Baroda in Gujarat, India, where we will be focusing on the history, culture and identity of South Asian communities in Leicester.

Aimed at local communities in Leicester and across the Midlands and to teachers and students from the arts, humanities and social sciences, the event will include screenings, an exhibition and workshop which trace broader journeys and overlapping migration stories over the last fifty years.

]]> No publisher User Submitted Magazine:Staff Magazine:Research Event:Conference College:Arts 2015-03-04T00:00:00Z UoL Event 'Capitalism from below: urban real estate markets and homeownership in Europe around 1900' https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/march/capitalism-from-below-urban-real-estate-markets-and-homeownership-in-europe-around-1900 Seminar Room, 5 Salisbury Road - 04 Mar 2015, 05:00PM - 06:30PM Joint Seminar from the Centre for Urban History and the Stanley Burton Centre: Prof. Alexander N\ufffd\ufffdtzenadel (Humboldt University Berlin): will be speaking on: 'Capitalism from below. Urban real estate markets and homeownership in Europe around 1900'.

Introduced by Prof. Simon Gunn and Dr. Alexander Korb

4 March 2015, 17:00-18:30 Seminar Room, 5 Salisbury Road

]]> No publisher User Submitted Magazine:Staff College:Arts Event:Lecture Magazine:Research 2015-03-04T17:00:00Z UoL Event Unveiling of the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdInspirational Women at Leicester\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd gallery https://www2.le.ac.uk/news/events/2015/march/unveiling-of-the-2018inspirational-women-at-leicester2019-gallery Garendon Room, 4th Floor Charles Wilson - 11 Mar 2015, 12:30PM - 01:30PM This year, for the first time, a series of events are being planned to celebrate International Women\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Day. The main event will be the unveiling of the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdInspirational Women at Leicester\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd gallery. This will take place on: Wednesday 11th March from 12.30pm - 1.30pm in the Ogden Lewis Suite, Fielding Johnson South Wing Basement.

Speakers: Professor Paul Boyle, Dr Angela Lennox

This event will also see the launch of the new women@Leicester webpages and the official launch of the women\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds forum. Please do come along to this as it would be great to have a good turnout.
